title: What explains recent tech layoffs, and why should we be worried? | Stanford News

last_post.content: TL;DR "We know layoffs don't really cut costs and they hurt productivity, but everyone else is doing them and our board wants to know why we aren't." https://news.stanford.edu/2022/12/05/explains-recent-tech-layoffs-worried/

title: How Finland Is Teaching a Generation to Spot Misinformation

last_post.content:
Finland has closely watched the Russian troll factory's efforts to create chaos in free democracies. We now educate our children to recognize #misinformation and rank #1 in our ability to resist it.

I wish the Americans would do the same.

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/10/world/europe/finland-misinformation-classes.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqIhkSVUaAybKWsIjolqLmOLI2LF7iH74KCGTRXNHzv8UBYaH4ULEeatkYZ442z2AX9Jadr8zQfg4hsluA3tQcSj66J2VhMZCZCwvtYO4Wm5x1smXBO5nqDKvYjbndKIileKy-huKO2n1UPDY1nZ3JV1np5pkZkjqjSJTvtrNFuF-3dV83f4zVNstFXpbOn7877S_AA5-Od6Hchjf9gE0PupbUj3RltSXgKkSJEQQURmVCSMivhtvrY9UK9gVP6zgLhY_e8eYgrwZDmVgLofBFIS5pvO9ZV-vudr4BKbnXCby

title: Stop Talking to Each Other and Start Buying Things: Three Decades of Survival in the Desert of Social Media

last_post.content:
Interested in enshittification? More to read…

@catvalente: Stop Talking to Each Other and Start Buying Things... >>> https://catvalente.substack.com/p/stop-talking-to-each-other-and-start

“Stop being human. A mindless bot who makes regular purchases is all that’s really needed.”

@pluralistic: What the fediverse (does/n't) solve (23 Dec 2022) >>> https://pluralistic.net/2022/12/23/semipermeable-membranes/#free-as-in-puppies

“They never quit trying to enclose the web, via proprietary browser extensions and dirty tricks”

2/4
#twittermigration

#ReleaseSunday Good things come to those who wait... After 10+ years, incl. 4+ years of release candidates and now prompted by a recent PR by @dimovich, earlier today I've released https://thi.ng/geom-clj v1.0.0 proper — a large, comprehensive #opensource 2D/3D geometry toolkit for both #Clojure & #ClojureScript. It's a massive project with too many features to list here, see readme & attached images for a partial list...

This was the first public project under the thi.ng moniker and from 2011-2016 I worked almost daily on it (though in it's current form it's the 4th rewrite). It also was the first project for which I decided to adapt a #LiterateProgramming process, using Emacs #OrgMode, allowing me to develop and intersperse source code with prose, sections, table of contents, reference/research links, tasks, diagrams, visualizations, tables & parametric code templates. Amazing productivity booster & dearly missed since... I continued using LP for several other large thi.ng libraries (most notably https://thi.ng/fabric), but in 2018 I decided to give up, since it proved to be a major hurdle for 3rd party contributions... 😢

In hindsight, the project, design and learnings from Clojure heavily inspired and directly expanded into my later (current!) #TypeScript work and the group of 20 new libraries under the same name (i.e. see https://thi.ng/geom). The latter is _not_ a direct port and currently still has a much stronger focus on 2D, yet again is one of the largest groups of libraries in the entire https://thi.ng/umbrella monorepo...

Online #pharmacies that sell #abortion pills are sharing sensitive data with #Google and other third parties, which may allow law enforcement to prosecute those who use the medications to end their #pregnancies, a @ProPublica analysis has found:

https://www.propublica.org/article/websites-selling-abortion-pills-share-sensitive-data-with-google

title: Pluralistic: Tiktok’s enshittification (21 Jan 2023) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
Enshittification: First platforms want your attention, so they show you stuff YOU want to see. Then they want your money, so they show you stuff THEY want you to see. @pluralistic calls this enshittification.

Tiktok's enshittification (21 Jan 2023) >>> https://pluralistic.net/2023/01/21/potemkin-ai/

This excellent essay examines how Amazon, Google, Facebook, Twitter and Tiktok, exploit algorithms to capture your attention, build dependency, and subsequently “monetize” you by feeding you shit.

1/4
#twittermigration

title: Pluralistic: Tiktok’s enshittification (21 Jan 2023) – Pluralistic: Daily links from Cory Doctorow

last_post.content:
This whole essay is so damn good that it was hard to pick a pull-quote.

"This is enshittification: surpluses are first directed to users; then, once they're locked in, surpluses go to suppliers; then once they're locked in, the surplus is handed to shareholders and the platform becomes a useless pile of shit."

https://pluralistic.net/2023/01/21/potemkin-ai/#hey-guys

Wow. RStudio (recently rebranded as Posit) is partnering with Palantir. Yes, the same Palantir with ties to Cambridge Analytica. The same Palantir that partners with and actively supports ICE and other oppressive surveillance.

This is really not ok ethically, and can only mean a bad direction functionally for the company's software going forward. I never use RStudio for research myself, but it looks like I'll stop using it in teaching.

https://finance.yahoo.com/news/palantir-posit-partner-integrate-rstudio-115900656.html

#rstudio #palantir #posit #ice

title: Don’t Fall for the AI Hype w/ Timnit Gebru - Tech Won’t Save Us

last_post.content: I might sound like a broken record, but the newest episode of Tech Won't Save Us on AI hype with @parismarx and AI expert and former Google Ethical AI co-lead @timnitGebru is, again, incredibly enlightening. Most of the silicon valley AI vanity projects seem to be, at the moment, little more than unregulated theft and VC/M&A marketing material when they could be used for good instead of profit. Required listening, especially for tech journos. https://www.techwontsave.us/episode/151_dont_fall_for_the_ai_hype_w_timnit_gebru

title: All-knowing machines are a fantasy | Emily M. Bender and Chriag Shah

last_post.content:
Just saw someone tweet a link to my op-ed with Chirag Shah from December 2022, saying "it's an older article but worth reading".

December 13th, to be exact. 40 days ago.

I mean, I realize that "news" ages faster than academic work, but the context of the OP was ... #ChatGPT, which is also the context for our op-ed.

https://iai.tv/articles/all-knowing-machines-are-a-fantasy-auid-2334

When electronics importer Cara Leon goes missing, private investigator Sam Mujrif is hired by her sister to investigate. Cara is 8 times taller than Sam, but evidence soon points to players much smaller than either of them.

As Sam and his cross-scale colleagues pursue the case, it becomes apparent that Cara’s disappearance is linked to technology with the potential to reshape their whole society, and radically alter the balance of power between the scales.

https://www.gregegan.net/SCALE/SCALE.html

Still looking for any #law and #legal programming (read: #podcasts, probably) that wouldn't mind being put on the @stream internet radio stream.

Current programming is, 7 days per week, 9am-7pm, rotation of original content (@emp, @icymi_law and your podcast, if you want!), with the rest of the time a mix of old #radio dramas and #SCOTUS oral arguments. All times EST.

Give me a shout if you're a podcaster, or know of one, and have any interest.

https://esqstream.com

@law @podcast #lawfedi

https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/twitter-mastodon-open-house-tickets-486784213687

#TVSMC #TVSMC23

So good to see another geographic data analysis paper with *full code* for reproducibility. This should be the default. Things are moving in the right direction! #geocompx #DataScience #gischat
---
RT @MiguelGLeonardo
🚨New paper w @nnewsh_ & @fcorowe in @GeogAnalysis

Understanding Population Decline Trajectories in Spain using Sequence Analysis

🔓Open access: https://doi.org/10.1111/gean.12357

🧑‍💻Code available for replicability…
https://twitter.com/MiguelGLeonardo/status/1615633998755123200

The map color palette editor to end all color palette editors?

http://MapColPal.org - "your pal for map color palettes".

Utterly fantastic new website by Valerian Lange, presented at #NIAM2023, wow!

OK this is actually pretty incredible.

The Smithsonian making 4 million digital items public domain. CC0 means you don't need to give attribution, there's no copyright to worry about, no restrictions on using them in photoshops etc.

It's a huge move for open media for such a big name to be making such a large collection open like this. It's the kind of thing I never really thought we would see start to happen.

https://www.si.edu/openaccess/

Are you an accessibility person? Do you have a website? Join the web ring! https://a11y-webring.club
(Thanks for setting it up, @eric!)

title: Thoughts on the Python packaging ecosystem

last_post.content:
I read this post on the current state of Python packaging with great interest because it's from someone who really understands and spends a lot of time in the Python open source/packaging ecosystem.

In all the time I've spend developing Python, a good 40%+ of my developer time has been spent trying to figure out how to ship and check code instead of writing it. There's no one easy solution, but maybe we could start with pip.

https://pradyunsg.me/blog/2023/01/21/thoughts-on-python-packaging/

title: Amazon closing AmazonSmile to focus its philanthropic giving to programs with greater impact

last_post.content:
You may have heard that Amazon is shutting down its "AmazonSmile" buy-and-donate-to-charity program. (https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/company-news/amazon-closing-amazonsmile-to-focus-its-philanthropic-giving-to-programs-with-greater-impact)

AmazonSmile wasn't a big part of IFTF's donation picture, but we did receive about US$60 per year through it. Thanks to everybody who thought of us when buying miscellaneous stuff!

If you were in that habit and you want to continue contributing via other means, check out https://iftechfoundation.org/give/ . (Paypal always works.)

You may have heard that Amazon is shutting down its "AmazonSmile" buy-and-donate-to-charity program. (https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/company-news/amazon-closing-amazonsmile-to-focus-its-philanthropic-giving-to-programs-with-greater-impact)

AmazonSmile wasn't a big part of IFTF's donation picture, but we did receive about US$60 per year through it. Thanks to everybody who thought of us when buying miscellaneous stuff!

If you were in that habit and you want to continue contributing via other means, check out https://iftechfoundation.org/give/ . (Paypal always works.)

title: This Guy Noticed Jigsaw Puzzle Companies Use The Same Patterns, So He Made Some Mashups

last_post.content:
Tim Klein noticed that #jigsaw puzzle companies tend to use the same cut patterns for multiple puzzles. This makes the pieces interchangeable.” So he’s combined puzzles to create these amazingly bizarre hybrid images…

#art

https://themindcircle.com/jigsaw-puzzle-companies-use-the-same-patterns/

#NerdHumor #Statistics

https://xkcd.com/2726/

title: Meet Millie - Your AI dating assistant to get 100% response rate on Tinder | Product Hunt

last_post.content:
"Meet Millie gives you the perfect pickup line, customized to your crush's interests."

Shocked-not-shocked that this happened so quickly. So many problems. Such grift. Such a cavalier approach to deception. Not surprised that "pick up artists" appears on their website's headline.

(side: we have a big paper coming out soon that exposes even more problems with such AI-driven services -- stay tuned!)

https://www.producthunt.com/posts/meet-millie

#ReleaseSunday Good things come to those who wait... After 10+ years, incl. 4+ years of release candidates and now prompted by a recent PR by @dimovich, earlier today I've released https://thi.ng/geom-clj v1.0.0 proper — a large, comprehensive #opensource 2D/3D geometry toolkit for both #Clojure & #ClojureScript. It's a massive project with too many features to list here, see readme & attached images for a partial list...

This was the first public project under the thi.ng moniker and from 2011-2016 I worked almost daily on it (though in it's current form it's the 4th rewrite). It also was the first project for which I decided to adapt a #LiterateProgramming process, using Emacs #OrgMode, allowing me to develop and intersperse source code with prose, sections, table of contents, reference/research links, tasks, diagrams, visualizations, tables & parametric code templates. Amazing productivity booster & dearly missed since... I continued using LP for several other large thi.ng libraries (most notably https://thi.ng/fabric), but in 2018 I decided to give up, since it proved to be a major hurdle for 3rd party contributions... 😢

In hindsight, the project, design and learnings from Clojure heavily inspired and directly expanded into my later (current!) #TypeScript work and the group of 20 new libraries under the same name (i.e. see https://thi.ng/geom). The latter is _not_ a direct port and currently still has a much stronger focus on 2D, yet again is one of the largest groups of libraries in the entire https://thi.ng/umbrella monorepo...
